Please be prepared with flashlights and essential supplies. Be cautious as you drive your vehicle, especially high profile vehicles, as high winds can cause loss of control, especially while traveling on bridges. Be mindful (especially during hours of darkness), of falling debris in the roadway, such as trees and signage. Please remember to secure your pets inside.

There will be no interruption in police services. If you have an emergency, please dial 911.

At Ogden School District we realize there is no question that children are always learning. The question is what they are learning and what are they retaining. There is always concern whether students will retain knowledge from one school year to the next. This year, because of covid-19, the concern is greater than ever.
Ogden School District implemented the Summer Bridge Program to help students make up for lost time from the spring and provide a smooth transition from last spring to their new grade level this fall. But the support being provided extends far beyond classroom learning. Deanie Wimmer KSL reported on KSL 5 TV that Ogden School District strives to care for the whole child.
Learn more about the Summer Bridge Program at summer.ogdensd.org.

Ogden's 2020 Census response rate is increasing, but there's still a ways to go. It is extremely important that everyone in the home, from the youngest to the oldest, COUNT in the U.S. Census Bureau.

Census data is completely confidential and is only used to produce statistics that provide funds for youth activities, such as classroom technology and free and reduced lunch, which many in our community are utilizing daily. The data also supports funding for affordable housing and transportation as well as health-related programs like CHIP, SNAP, Medicaid and Medicare.

Take 10 minutes today to fill out the Census. It super simple and can be done on the computer or by telephone and with the support of a Census worker.

Ogden City Government is counting on each and everyone of their residents doing their part to support the community and ensuring they count in the 2020 Census.

The Great Utah ShakeOut is this Thursday, April 16 at 10:15 a.m. The district is encouraging everyone to participate in the statewide drill.

During the Drill: DROP, COVER and HOLD ON!
At 10:15 a.m. drop, cover and hold on for at least 60 seconds then evacuate your building/home and ensure that you are at least 1 1/2 times the height of your building/home away from your building/home. After accounting for all of your family or peers, practice a rapid assessment on the outside or your building/home. Debrief with your family or peers and improve your plan.

Take the time to look around your school, home and community to ensure you have a plan in place for yourself, your family and your school community. Prepare grab and go bags to ensure you have 24 hours worth of supplies, such as a change of clothing, food and water, needed documents, a flashlight and a first aid kit.

Congratulations to Ogden High School senior Philip Jimenez! Phillip was named a 2020 Daniels Scholar and was awarded a comprehensive, four-year college scholarship by the Daniels Scholarship Program. CLEAN AIR!

Many Ogden School District students suffer from some form of asthma. On high pressure days this can be very problematic as air quality deteriorates due to smog and particle pollution.

Each year, OSD partners with the Weber-Morgan Health Department, Ogden City Council and Ogden City Government, to bring awareness to the community to support the need for a greater collective effort to protect our children's health!

Help us and ‚ÄúTurn Your Key, Be Idle Free‚Äù at all of our schools. The goal is to reduce vehicle idling and unhealthy emissions while parents and others are dropping off and picking up students. The problem is particularly worse in the afternoons when vehicles are sometimes left idling for up to 20-30 minutes. This idling creates an area known as a hot spot, exposing children to higher levels of concentrated pollution.

We‚Äôre asking everyone to please help eliminate excessive emissions at our schools. The rule of thumb should be no idling for more than two minutes.

Thank you for all you do to keep our students healthy and safe!

Ogden School District wants to congratulate three Ogden High School students from the Ogden High School Bands that participated in the All-State Band and Orchestra. These ensembles are Utah's premier audition only groups. Students must audition against all other qualified musicians from every high school across the state.

"The competition is fierce and it was great to see our students have this opportunity to represent our school," said OHS teacher Stan Renda. "I am very proud of their achievements and how they represented Ogden High to the highest of standards this weekend. Please congratulate these wonderful students!"

Ryan Petty - Tuba - 1st Chair, Maddox Lister - Percussion, and Brody Lister - Percussion spent Thursday and Friday rehearsing their music with highly recognized conductors and educators from across the United States and it concluded with a concert at Abravanel Hall in downtown Salt Lake City on Saturday.

A little prior to 1887, a group of folks came into town talking education this and education that. They built a school named Ogden Academy, which had a time capsule buried inside the corner stone of the building, which will be unveiled.

That same building become the first Ogden High in 1898 and the rest is history‚Äìliterally!

Join us on January 18 for a FREE fun day at the library and learn some interesting history about Ogden, listen to great presentations and participate in making your own time capsule.

See you there!
